facetValues.label: Ancient Mediterranean and Near Eastern Studies (Vancouver)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
An advanced scholarly writing course focusing on knowledge-making, its discursive expression in disciplinary contexts and methods for its analysis.  Although this section of WRDS 350 is designed specifically for IDST students and the unique research and writing expectations of IDST scholarship, it will appeal to any student interested in developing a grounding in the practices of interdisciplinary thinking and writing.Seats reserved at the beginning of Registration for IDST students.
This course can be used toward the Minor in Writing and Communication. Visit http://jwam.ubc.ca/undergraduate/writing-studies-programs/minor-in-writing-and-communication/ for more information.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course can be used toward the Minor in Writing and Communication. Visit http://jwam.ubc.ca/undergraduate/writing-studies-programs/minor-in-writing-and-communication/ for more information.

instances.text: WRDS_V 360-010 - Knowledge Popularization: Research Writing in New Media

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Instagram. Blogs. TED Talks. YouTube. Podcasts. These and many other new media genres are increasingly transforming the way research is received and circulated beyond academic institutions and used by public audiences. In a fast-changing communication landscape, it is necessary to understand the rhetorical purposes of these genres, the stylistic features and strategies that make their circulation of research (in)effective, and how, through new media genres, public audiences are using, reframing, and even subverting knowledge produced in the academy. In this course, students will analyze, critically assess, and produce these forms of media themselves.

See course description here: WRDS Undergraduate Course Descriptions - School of Journalism, Writing, and Media (ubc.ca)

This course can be used towards the Minor in Writing and Communication: Minor in Writing and Communication - School of Journalism, Writing, and Media (ubc.ca).

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
